page.title: 11HOUSING : MOTTRAM ST ANDREW
page.content: The{Hamlet}of{Mottram},like{Alderley}, is mentioned in the{Domesday Book of {1086.}It is a hamlet where people live but there are no shops.Most of the houses are detached or semi-detached. The older houses are mainly semi- detached. There is a new estate of bungalows on the road to Alderley.It was a{council {estate}but now the bungalows are{ {privately owned.} Further out from the village centre the dwellings are mostly{farm houses.} Generally they are large detached houses in{Georgian style.}There are many outhouses and barns on each farm. Some farms are no longer part of working farms,but are{homes for {prosperous people.
